revised_title: High-Resolution Infrared Solar Spectroscopy at the Jungfraujoch
tldr: This article discusses the advancements in high-resolution infrared solar spectroscopy at the Jungfraujoch, focusing on techniques to correct for the effects of the instrumental function and increase the signal-to-noise ratio in records. The authors describe their work at the International Scientific Station of the Jungfraujoch, which is known for its excellent location for observing the solar spectrum in the water-vapor absorption regions. They also discuss the use of a double-pass arrangement with a narrow intermediate slit to improve the apparatus function and the correction for the effect of the instrumental profile.
